questions.clue: This ancient civilization is known for its cuneiform writing system and the myth of Gilgamesh.
Located in modern-day Mexico, this civilization is renowned for its pyramids and the city of Teotihuacan.
This empire, established by Cyrus the Great, was known for its road systems and tolerance of conquered peoples.
This Mesoamerican civilization is famous for the ball game and advanced calendar system.
Known for the iconic Moai statues, this Polynesian civilization thrived on Rapa Nui.
In 1905, 11-year-old Frank Epperson accidentally invented this popular frozen treat when he left a cup of powdered soda and water with a stick in it outside overnight.
In 1928, candy company Reese's created their iconic peanut butter cups, combining these two common flavors.
In 1930, Ruth Wakefield invented this dessert by accident when pieces of a semi-sweet chocolate bar didn't melt into the dough of her cookies.
In 1943, the war-time innovation by Dr. Percy Spencer led to the invention of this kitchen appliance, which cooks food using electromagnetic waves.
In 1963, this spreadable cheese in an aerosol can was first introduced, making it a quick and easy snack topping.
For $200: Known for their symmetrical shape, these six-sided crystalline forms can be found in snowflakes.
For $400: This sequence, found in sunflower seed arrangements and pinecones, starts 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8...
For $600: The spiral patterns observed in nautilus shells are often examples of this type of logarithmic spiral.
For $800: These distinctive shapes, formed by repeated addition, create the fractal coastlines and are present in broccoli.
For $1000: Named after a 19th-century mathematician, this mathematical model explains the branching of trees and circulatory systems.
In William Shakespeare's 'Macbeth,' this character's ambition and manipulation lead him to murder the king.
In J.K. Rowling's 'Harry Potter' series, this dark wizard seeks immortality and power over both wizards and Muggles.
This Herman Melville character is driven by a monomaniacal quest for revenge against a giant white whale.
In Arthur Conan Doyle's 'Sherlock Holmes' stories, this criminal mastermind's motive is to control the criminal underworld of London.
In Mary Shelley's 'Frankenstein,' this creature’s monologues reveal his desire for acceptance and vengeance against his creator.
Emerging in the late 18th century, this movement emphasized emotion over reason, a reaction to the Industrial Revolution.
This 19th-century French artist led the Impressionist movement, which defied traditional subject matter and style.
The harsh lines and geometric shapes of this 20th-century movement were inspired by African art and led by Picasso and Braque.
This artistic movement of the early 20th century originated in Italy, emphasizing speed and modern technology.
Emerging as a reaction to World War I, this avant-garde movement rejected logic and embraced chaos and irrationality.

final.clue: Patented in 1843, this invention by Sir Charles Wheatstone was crucial in developing long-distance communication, laying groundwork for the modern telecommunications we use today.
